attributes.action: Keep mask wearing mandatory at indoor public places after July 19th
attributes.additional_details: With the number of infections of the Delta variant continuing to grow and with us seemingly now in a third wave of the virus its the wrong time to remove mask wearing on top of the ending of social distancing rules. If you don't keep mask wearing mandatory the virus is going to spiral out of control putting many vulnerable people at risk. This will lead to many of those people from avoiding social interactions, this will not allow people to get their freedoms back, it will take them away.
attributes.background: I call on the Government to keep mask wearing at indoor public places mandatory after July the 19th, especially on public transport, in shops, theatres, cinemas and other indoor venues where lots of people may gather. This will reduce the spread of the virus and protect vulnerable people.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Keep mandatory face coverings in supermarkets and on public transport: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590836
 
Keep face masks mandatory for public transport after the lifting of restrictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590694

Keep requirement to wear a face covering in shops & supermarkets after July 19th: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590829
